description: Base schema for a Solargis data request (schema of all request attributes) - not used in public APIs. See special public request types derived from the base.

fromDate.description: Start date of the requested data. Inclusive. See also the utcOffset.

toDate.description: End date of the requested data. Inclusive. See also the utcOffset.

utcOffset.description: ISO 8601 time zone designator (offset from UTC) formatted as [±]hh:mm. Allows only whole hour or half-hour offsets in the range ±14:30. If this property is missing the UTC is used (00:00).

timeAlignment.description: Datetime strings (labels of time intervals) can be positioned or aligned with the start, center or end of the time interval (or the left edge, the middle and the right edge of the time interval).

terrainShading.description: This attribute affects all related parameters (e.g., GHI, DIF, DNI, GTI, PVOUT, TMOD except parameters with explicit _NOSHD suffix.)

gtiConfiguration.description: Object is required if at least one GTI related column is present in the array of columns.

pvConfiguration.description: Object is required if at least one PV output related column is present in the array of columns (also the TMOD parameter).
pvConfiguration.$comment: TODO add v2, for now we have legacy v1

stochasticGenerator.description: For 1, 5 and 10 minute time steps, the solar irradiation values can be synthetically generated from 15 minute data.

includeSurfaceAlbedoLongTerm.description: Include long-term average of surface albedo in the output dataset. The value is taken from the user request (if value is present) or from the Solargis database (if not provided by user). Only for SOLARGIS_JSON format.

includeHorizon.description: Include horizon object in the output dataset (used for shading). The value is taken from the user request (if value is present) or from the Solargis database (if not provided by user). Only for SOLARGIS_JSON format.

includeJsonData.description: Include data section in the dataset. If false, the data is provided elsewhere e.g., as file or URI, and dataset just holds the metadata. Only for SOLARGIS_JSON format.

includeModelUncertaintyYearly.description: Include details about the yearly model uncertainty in the processing section of the metadata.
includeModelUncertaintyYearly.$comment: For TMY datasets for other scenario than P50 (e.g., P90, P75, PXX...) the false value is ignored internally and the uncertainty details are always included in datasets.
